channel.title: Im a retard #2
channel.description:
ok, my client's "run" application is not working because i edited it and did pasted my environmental variable. now it just says
C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.7.0_05\bin; is not recognized as a command or something like that.
C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.7.0_05\bin; is my environmental variable.
How can i make my client's run application work.

item.title: Im a retard #2
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

fix your enviromental variables to

CLASSPATH
C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.7.0_05\bin;%CLASSPATH%;

PATH
C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_04\bin;

put these under user variables for (YOUR LOGIN NAME)

Read full topic

item.title: Im a retard #2
item.dc:creator: @kingcobra805 kingcobra805
item.description:
@kingcobra805 wrote:

[quote=“Belob0g, post:8, topic:452637”][quote author=kingcobra805 link=topic=555514.msg4067076#msg4067076 date=1343975018]
ok, if that is your run thats not correct at all. your trying to make your server run via a JDK

and you dont use Javac for run’s
use jre7

Download Jre7 edit your run.bat place this in there.

“C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre7\bin\java.exe”
[/quote]

will that work? I already downloaded jdk, if i download jre it will get fucked up.[/quote]

how will your jdk get fucked up if you download jre? o.O i have jre6, jre7, jdk 7.u5 jdk 7u4 and mine are perfectly fine i can choose which ever one i like, but if you want show all of your run.bat it just makes it easier to fully know and fix the problem.

Read full topic

item.title: Im a retard #2
item.dc:creator: @tyrucca tyrucca
item.description:
@tyrucca wrote:

Or you could try -
@echo off
title Client
java -Xmx300m client
pause
